results.title: Fire awareness
results.brief_description: Discusses the nature of fire awareness and looks at the nature of fire, the causes of fire, the behaviour of fire and fire safety management. Also looks at fire prevention, protection and supression. Technical advice for the video was supplied by the Metropolitan Fire Brigade, and Fire Prevention Department, Melbourne. A manual complements the video and is issued as a separate loan item.

results.title: Fire and ice [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ralph Bakshi, Frank Frazetta and Polyc International
results.brief_description: This animated feature is set in a mythical Ice Age, where, Juliana, a powerful Queen of the North, seeks to gain control the rest of the realm. In this realm also resides the good King, Jarol, who lives in his fortress of fire and his sworn enemy, evil ice Lord Nekron, who lives with his army of subhumans amongst the glaciers. Nekron uses his powers of sorcery to create havoc and orders the subhumans to kidnap Jarol’s daughter. Thus a war is waged between fire and ice in a desperate battle for survival. Jarol, with help from the warrior hero Darkwolf must save mankind from the apocalyptic icy grave that awaits them if evil is to reign. Featuring the voices of Stephen Mendel, Maggie Roswell, Leo V. Gordon and Steve Sandor. Director Ralph Bakshi is best known for his animated adult feature “Fritz the cat”.

results.title: Fire's the enemy
results.brief_description: Shows recent developments in civil defence training: the latest fire-fighting equipment; emergencies a community may have to cope with during a serious outbreak and how the individual as well as the community may deal with an actual attack. Training of new recruits is also described.

results.title: Fire
results.creator_credit: Deepa Mehta, Bobby Bedi and Trial by Fire Films
results.brief_description: The first in a trilogy encompassing ‘Fire’, ‘Earth’ and ‘Water’, Deepa Mehta’s engrossing study of a lesbian affair interweaves sexual repression, pressure-cooker desire, crumbling patriarchy and cultural transformation in contemporary India. The tugging away of traditional structures reflects social changes and the tension of modernism occurring across the sub-continent. Radha, the driving force behind husband Ashok’s New Delhi restaurant, cohabits peacefully, if at times uneasily, with her in-laws upstairs. Their barren 15 year old marriage is rent asunder by the arrival of sister-in-law Sita, a confident modern young wife who poses questions Radha would rather not face. Their husbands’ complacency and neglect draws the women into a tender relationship which detonates into tragedy. Cast includes Shaban Azmi, Nandita Das, Kulbushan Kharband and Jaared Jaaferi. In English and Bengali with English subtitles.

results.title: Fire
results.brief_description: This film shows the bushfires which wiped out the town of Dwellingup and Nangabrook in Western Australia in January 1961. From the first outbreaks through the five day bushfire raging through jarrah forest, pasture and townships. The volunteer firefighters in action, attempts to plough or burn firebreaks, the trail of damage left behind, the relief work, rebuilding and new growth after the fire.

results.title: Fire
results.brief_description: Animated impressionistic film portraying an idyllic forest alive with plants and animals that suddenly grows quiet as ominous clouds of black smoke roll over the landscape, and fire consumes everything in its path.

results.title: Fips the trouble maker
results.brief_description: Puppet film for children and without commentary. Tells the story of the irrepressible trouble-maker Fips, a mischievous toy maker. He interrupts the elephant and bear and two dolls who are reading a story, knocks their toys over, and is sat in the corner, until one relents and lets him have a bowl whereupon he knocks down all the pins first go!

results.title: Fiorile
results.creator_credit: Vittorio Taviani, Paolo Taviani, Grazia Volpi, Pentafilm and Filmtre-Gierre Film
results.brief_description: A family travels through the Italian country side to visit their sick grandfather. On the journey two young children hear their father recount the story of their heritage. Spanning two centuries and beginning during the Napoleonic invasion of Italy, it centres around gold and its power to corrupt. A young soldier, Jean, left guarding the regiment’s chest of gold has it stolen while he is making love to a peasant girl, Elisabetta. The soldier is charged and will be put to death if the gold isn’t recovered. The thief, Elisabetta’s brother, will not own up and shame his family, the soldier is killed. This is the beginning of the family’s troubles, Elisabetta dies during childbirth and generations after are effected by the curse. Their surname Benedetti, meaning blessed, becomes known as “Maledetti”, cursed. The effect through the generations is emphasised by actors playing dual roles. Starring Claudio Bigali, Galatea Ranzi, Michael Vartan and Lino Capolicchio.

results.title: Finlandia
results.brief_description: A study of one of the greatest of contemporary composers, Jan Sibelius, born in Finland in 1865. Music played by the Helsinki Philharmonic Orchestra, includes excerpts from the Finlandia Suite, and the immortal Second Symphony in D Major.
results.description: A study of one of the greatest of contemporary composers, Jan Sibelius, born in Finland in 1865. Music played by the Helsinki Philharmonic Orchestra, includes excerpts from the Finlandia Suite, and the immortal Second Symphony in D Major.

results.title: Finland designs for living
results.brief_description: This film presents the beauty and variety of modern design on Finland. Shows designers at work at their drawing boards and in their studios creating by hand, what is later mass produced in the factory. Includes steel saucepans and cutlery, colorful weaving, the creation of pottery, its earliest stage as clay turning on a hand-wheel and beautiful glass being blown by skilled craftsmen working closely with the designer of the product.
